availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Vincent S. Hay (Warren County, Kentucky, lawyer and soldier)

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, lawyer and soldier. Kentucky native. Lawyer in Butler County, Kentucky, in 1850. Graduated from the University of Louisville in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on March 1, 1853. Lawyer in Warren County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the Eleventh Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private and a quartermaster from December 9, 1861, to February 27, 1863. Died in a prisoner of war camp in Atlanta, Georgia, on February 27, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Butler County, p. 276A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 852.
Catalogue of the Officers and Students in the Law Department of the University of Louisville, 1859-60, (Louisville, KY: Hull & Brother, Printers, 1860), 12.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 398.
U.S., Registers of Deaths of Volunteers, 1861-1865, NARA RG 94, Kentucky, A-K, p. 141.
